page.title: 11 FLINT
page.content:
The{South Downs}are made of chalk. Mixed with the chalk are lumps or nodules of flint. Flint is a mineral and almost indestructible. It may be black, grey or brown and is usually covered in a layer of chalk. At{Stoke Down}there were Stone Age flint mines. Thousands of years ago men dug for flint using antler tools. Flint was chipped to make sharp edges for axes,arrow heads and knives. Nodules of flint can be easily picked up from the soil surface. We collected a lump and measured it. Mass 479g
Volume 227ml (by displacement)
Density 2.11g per ml
